bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Clyde L. West, November 27, 1941

div1.p: Hench discusses his yellow fever research and sends West a copy of his “Conquerors of Yellow Fever” article. He mentions West's participation in the experiments.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Clyde L. West, November 27, 1941
div1.opener:
MAYO CLINIC
ROCHESTER, MINNESOTA
November 27, 1941
DR. PHILIP S. HENCH
DR. CHARLES H. SLOCUMB
Mr. Clyde L. West
Riverdale, Md.
My dear Mr. West:
div1.p:
I have been interested in the story of the conquest of yellow
fever and have been doing some study of it the past four or five years.
I have had the pleasure of corresponding with many of those concerned
and have visited Kissinger, Moran, General Kean, Miss Agramonte, Walter
Reed's daughter and others. I have just published an article on Conquerors
of Yellow Fever; you are mentioned in this article and I am sending you a
few copies by separate post. If you want more, I'd be glad to send as
many as you wish.

I should deem it a privilege to correspond with you. It has
been a deep source of satisfaction to me to be able in a very small way
to honor you who helped to conquer yellow fever.
div1.closer: Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
